alert.note: Alert for Harding; Quay; San Miguel; Union (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 24 at 4:34PM MDT until May 24 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... Southeastern Harding County in northeastern New Mexico... Northeastern Quay County in east central New Mexico... Southeastern Union County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 530 PM MDT. * At 434 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles south of Bueyeros to 8 miles northeast of Tucumcari, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Tucumcari, Logan, Mosquero, Nara Visa, Glenrio, Ute Lake State Park and Rosebud. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 330 and 348, and between Mile Markers 366 and 373. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 94 and 105. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Accumulations of hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
